item.title: Persistent Waste Collection Problem Causing Health and Safety Concerns, 2nd August
item.description:
Restaurant waste is not being collected regularly, causing garbage to pile up and spread to residents' doorsteps. The sidewalk is covered in grease and dirt, making it unsafe and unhygienic. The waste collection point is poorly located on a very narrow sid

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bradbury Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Parking on the common, 2nd August
item.description:
The car is illegally parked on a no parking area. It is blocking access to the road. After I spoke with the car owner they refused to move it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Avenue, Balham, London

item.title: Rubbish dumped from cars parked along the kerb, 2nd August
item.description:
Rubbish along the kerb of St Andrews Drive which needs to be cleaned when the cars are NOT parked there so first thing in the morning it needs to be swept. There used to be a regular road sweeper along Carlton Parade and the side roads but now you have to always report it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, The Greenway, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter, 2nd August
item.description:
The druggies and drug dealers are leaving litter on the T green and at the top as it merges with the woods. The litter bins are too small, foxes also pull the litter out. It’s disgusting, people don’t want to walk there dogs in this area because of the mess.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rutherglen Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 2nd August
item.description:
In thomes lane se6 4RQ next to the traffic lights are 20 black bags with food and clothes on top of the black bags this was reported last week this is health and safety hazard you need to get on to environmental health and safety people because it’s going to get very bad the rubbish is rising up the walls

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Catford Broadway, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement too high and uneven, 2nd August
item.description:
The pavement is in extremely bad condition and was reported 3 years ago as it is far too high and giving way from the railway bridge down to the elephant theatre people cannot get out of their car without damaging the door. This has been reported numerous times and nothing has been done

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Bethwin Road, Camberwell, London
